oai_dc:dc.dc:title: David Henley
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Government officials; Military officers
Henley, David, 1749-1823; United States -- History -- Revolution, 1775-1783 -- Prisoners and prisons
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Henley served as an officer in the War for Independence, commissioner for settling Virginia claims, and agent for the War Department in the Territory South of the River Ohio. The Territory was created in 1790 from lands ceded by North Carolina. The Southwest Territory ceased existence in 1796, the year Tennessee became a state.
